AcouPipe 01.06.2021 documentation
previous | next | modules | index

SetSampler¶

class acoupipe.sampler.SetSampler¶

Bases: acoupipe.sampler.BaseSampler

Random process that draws one or multiple values from a given set of values and assigns those to the target.

random_var = Enum(None)¶

not needed for this sampler; relies on numpy choice function.

random_state = Either(Generator,RandomState,default=RandomState(), …¶

the state of the random variable (defaults to numpy.random.RandomState )

attribute = Str("",  …¶

attribute of the object in the target list that should be sampled by the random variable

numsamples = Enum(1, …¶

number of samples to be drawn from the set (fixed to one)

replace = Bool(True,  …¶

whether to use the replace argument of numpy.random.choice() function

prob_list = List([],  …¶

Probability List, same lenght as the set, need to sum up to 1 If left empty assume uniform distribution

get_sample_propabilities()¶

return propabilities associated with the samples in the given set (for internal use).

rvs(size=1)¶

random variable sampling (for internal use)

sample()¶

this function utilizes rvs() function to draw values from set list that are going to be assigned to the target instance attribute.
